citation.article-title: Methylovulum miyakonense gen. nov., sp. nov., a type I methanotroph isolated from forest soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Methylovulum (Me.thy.lo.vu′lum. N.L. neut. n. methyl the methyl group; N.L. neut. n. ovulum small egg; N.L. neut. n. Methylovulum small methyl-using egg).
Cells are Gram-reaction-negative, aerobic, non-motile, coccoid- or short-rod-shaped and possess stacks of intracytoplasmic membranes, typical of type I methanotrophs.
Growth is observed on methane and methanol as sole carbon sources.
Methane is oxidized by pMMO and sMMO.
C1 compounds are assimilated via the ribulose monophosphate pathway.
Major cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0 and C14 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 49 mol%.
Phylogenetically, a member the family Methylococcaceae (type I methanotrophs) in the class Gammaproteobacteria.
The most closely related genus is Methylosoma.
The type species is Methylovulum miyakonense.
